Key: Mm...
(Hey, I'm not... in my room.)
Um... Where am I...?!

(I immediately sat up and my brain started to wake
up―That's right... I slept in Rinne's room with Rio...
but where's... Rio?)
...Where did Rio go?

(It was just Rinne and me in the bed... That's not
good.)

(...Maybe I can go home while she's sleeping. I'm
sure Kotori isn't back yet... And Maria may know
where Rio went.)
...Mm... Shido... is...it... delicious...?
Thanks, Rinne... I'll see you later.
Mmm... okay... zzz...

(I couldn't tell if Rinne responded or not, but she
started to breathe steadily again.)
(I need to hurry home. I feel a bit awkward...)
Phew. The morning sun feels nice.

(After changing in the living room, I stood outside
and stretched. And then I turned around.)

(Rinne's house felt like she was living there. In
other words... it was no longer a place where Rinne
just spent her downtime.)

(Rinne was born again in this world, and she's living
her normal life. That made me a bit happy.)

(Rinne isn't a Spirit. Reine-san told me after Eden
ended.)

(A fake world with fake settings. Rinne was the
manager. And her existence wasn't real.)

(I've been looking at Rinne until today and I thought
about something. Rinne probably wants the real thing.)

(A bond with everyone after you spend time together.
Just like Rinne said herself the other day.)

(The cooking class yesterday was also the same.
Rinne wasn't doing it for me, but for herself.)

(But this will all end soon. According to Rio and
Marina, it could be tomorrow... or even today. The
time is definitely nearing.)
I have to make a decision.
(I put a hand over my heart, as if to promise myself.)
Oh, Shido... You sure seem to be home early.
K-Kotori?! Why are you up this early?

*Yawn*... I just got home a bit ago, too. You didn't
look like you weren't coming in at all. So I was just
waiting for you.
Ah... I see. Sorry for keeping you.

Forget about that. Shido, you're stressed about
something, aren't you? You've been acting weird the
past few days.
...Gosh, you really are something.
Well, we are family you know? So, what happened?

Sorry, Kotori. I... can't say anything this time. There's
something I need to do.
It's about Rinne, isn't it? Or is it Maria?
...?! Kotori, do you know everything already...?

No... But I know that much. I mean, when you look at
them, there are times when you're looking off into
the distance. It's kind of like you're... the old you.
I see... I suck at hiding things, huh?
You do. But I'm not going to ask you right now.
Huh?

I told you, I'm going to let you do what you want.
An adorable little sister's role is to push you from
behind when you need it, right?
...Thanks.

Hehe... But you owe me one. I'm sure Tohka and the
others aren't up yet, so I'm going to go sleep a bit
longer. You do what you need to.
Thanks, Kotori.
Hang in there, Onii-chan.
Right.

(I can't have Kotori support me while I just stand
there doing nothing. I will find an answer―today.)

(I looked all over the house, but I couldn't find Rio
or Maria. She should have been home.)

(Eden is coming to an end. Maybe Rio―and Marina
helping her―are in a rush.)

(I took out the small bag in my drawer. Inside was a
spare key. A spare key I handed to Rinne in the last
Eden.)
(And... what Rinne left to me.)

(Once the normal days returned, that feeling of loss
struck pain in my heart once again. It's as if it were
screaming so I wouldn't forget.)
But I have to go.
(I came here to do everything I've come to do.)
...She's awake by now, right?

(It's past 10. It's not like we were up especially late,
so Rinne should be up by now...)
Who is it...
Huh? Shido? Oh, did you forget something?

Oh, no... It's not that. Rinne, do you have some free
time today?

I don't have anything to do in particular... What's
the matter? I woke up and both you and Rio-chan
were gone, so I was a little surprised.

Yeah, sorry. I thought I'd try to get home before
Kotori got back.

(However, she was standing like a gladiator at the
entrance.)

Oh, I see. Sorry, I didn't think about that. So,
where's Rio-chan?

When I got home, Maria wasn't home. So I think
they're together...
I see... I'm a little worried.

It's fine. Maria and Marina are by her side. I'm sure
they're just taking a stroll together.

I see. You're right. So what about you, Shido?
If it's not about Rio-chan, what did you need to talk
to me about?

Right. It's not a big deal, but would you come with
me?

Sure. You want to go shopping, right? I'll go with
you. Since it's morning, should we go to the station―
―Let's go on a date, Rinne.

...Excuse me? Sorry, Shido. I couldn't hear you.
Can you say it again?

We're going on a date, Rinne. We didn't finish the
last one.

Date... with me? Are you serious? You don't have to
feel sorry for me...

No. I want to go on a date with you, Rinne. So come
with me.

...Haha. That's not fair, Shido. If you're going to
put it that way... how can I say no?

Yeah. I know I'm not fair. Did you not know that
already?

No. I know all too well... That's what I like about
you.

...*Grunt*. Th-Thanks. So will you get ready? I'll be
waiting here.
Okay. Then give me a bit more time okay, darling?
What?! Wh-Where did that come from?
I just copied Miku-san. Anyways, be right back.
Gosh... Rinne.
(As I said it, I could feel myself smiling.)
I... I like that part of you, too.

(I knew she couldn't hear me, but I just wanted to
say it anyway.)
